𒉏 ≈ 𒄴 ᵛIḪ Viech Vieh 𒄴 ᴮAḪ bug "insect"

𒉏 NIM ≈ 𒄴 numun₃ ἔντομον éntomon "insect"

𒉏 "insect" NIM <> 𒁞 نملة namla ant
𒉏 "insect" N…M насеко́мо nasekómo 𒉏 "insect" N…KOM насеко́мо کیٛۆم kyom кома́ха komáxa 𒉏 "insect" N'TOM ἔντομον éntomon гмыз ⁿhmyz միջատ miǰat

𒄿𒄀𒋼𒉏 ˢi-gi-ten-num •section (Trennung) 𒄿𒄀𒋼𒉏 fraction

𒉏 ἔντομον éntomon reading with T supported by 𓇗 זַמָּר, 𒉏 ḫatamti :

Elam

Hebrew עֵילָם ʿēlām Akkadian 𒉏𒈠𒆠 ELAM.MAKI /elamtu/ Sumerian 𒉏𒆠 (ELAMKI /Elam/) Elamite 𒄬𒆷𒁶𒋾 ḫal-la-tam₆-ti haltamti "highland" <> 𒂊𒇻 ʱe-lu Elamite 𜎽𜏂𜓝𜏧 ha-ta-m-ti Hatamti "Elam"

𒉏 #zumbu זַמָּר ᵗzamár 𓇗 𒉏 NAM 𒉆𒈜 nam-nar namnar musicianship

𒉏 ≈ 𓉗 hut in 𒉏𒈠𒆠

𒉏 •nam 𒈾 Nahr 𓆛 Narmer vs AP 𒀖 𒉏 ≈ 𓆢 ≠ 𓆛 namak 🐟🐠🐡 minu nuun 𒄩 nūnu KU6 𓆛 NA 𒈾 魚 (na) 𓆛 ܢܘܢܐ nūnā 𒉏 ≈ 𓆢 Nimrod ≈ Narmer as founding figure (𓃮 <> Dionysus Hercules Heracles ) 𒉏 ≠ 𓆛 = 𒆨 KISIM5 (fish)

𒅤𒊭 𒀭𒈹𒂞 𒑐𒋼𒋛 𒈹𒂞𒆠 𒄊𒀴 𒈣𒋾 𒉏𒆠 puzur-inshushinak ensi shushiki skakkanakku mati NIMki), "Puzur-Inshushin(ak) Ensi (Governor) of Susa, Shakkanakku (Military Governor) of the country of Elam"

𒁞 ≈ 𒆨 ≈ 𒉏 NIM نملة namla ant

𒉏 -ming -ment 𓅓 𓄣 gerund prefix nam IM … / suffix … -ing
𒉏 •ming ≈ morning in 𒆥𒉏 morning meal 𒆥𒋝 afternoon meal (𒆥 KIĜ₂ •Gang)

𒉏 LAM < ram in 𒋗𒉏 šuᵖram s'primavera "spring" 𒉏 LAM lente Lenz 𒉏 LAM Lamm in 𒃢𒉏 spring lamb permuted 𒉏 NIM ненңени ņenңeņi нэгин nəgin άνοιξη ánoixi 𒃢𒉏 "spring"
